20110127231059.000|20110127231102.000|TR0|today, "The Guardian" was reporting that

20110127232019.000|20110127232021.000|TR0|
20110127232021.000|20110127232024.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN ANCHOR:  What if, on 
20110127232024.000|20110127232026.000|TR0|your child's next report card, his teacher 
20110127232026.000|20110127232028.000|TR0|gave you a grade along with the child?  A 
20110127232028.000|20110127232031.000|TR0|Florida state lawmaker is proposing 
20110127232031.000|20110127232033.000|TR0|exactly that.
20110127232033.000|20110127232036.000|TR0|
20110127232036.000|20110127232038.000|TR0|Representative Kelli Stargel thinks that 
20110127232038.000|20110127232040.000|TR0|public school teachers should grade 
20110127232040.000|20110127232043.000|TR0|parents of students from kindergarten 
20110127232043.000|20110127232045.000|TR0|through the third grade.  These grades of 
20110127232045.000|20110127232048.000|TR0|"satisfactory," "unsatisfactory" or "needs 
20110127232048.000|20110127232050.000|TR0|improvement" would show up on the 
20110127232050.000|20110127232052.000|TR0|student's report card.
20110127232052.000|20110127232055.000|TR0|
20110127232055.000|20110127232057.000|TR0|The Republican lawmaker says parental 
20110127232057.000|20110127232059.000|TR0|involvement is key to educating children.  
20110127232059.000|20110127232102.000|TR0|She's of course absolutely right.
20110127232102.000|20110127232104.000|TR0|
20110127232104.000|20110127232107.000|TR0|According to the proposed legislation, the 
20110127232107.000|20110127232109.000|TR0|grading system would be based on three 
20110127232109.000|20110127232111.000|TR0|things, one, the student should show up to 
20110127232111.000|20110127232114.000|TR0|school on time and ready to learn, 
20110127232114.000|20110127232116.000|TR0|well-rested and fed.  Two, the student 
20110127232116.000|20110127232119.000|TR0|should have done his homework and be 
20110127232119.000|20110127232121.000|TR0|prepared for any tests that might be 
20110127232121.000|20110127232123.000|TR0|given.  And, three, there should be 
20110127232123.000|20110127232126.000|TR0|regular communication between the parent 
20110127232126.000|20110127232128.000|TR0|and teacher, all of which seems perfectly 
20110127232128.000|20110127232131.000|TR0|logical and reasonable.
20110127232131.000|20110127232133.000|TR0|
20110127232133.000|20110127232135.000|TR0|Some experts call this a unique idea, but 
20110127232135.000|20110127232138.000|TR0|others object, saying that teachers are in 
20110127232138.000|20110127232140.000|TR0|no position to judge parenting.
20110127232140.000|20110127232143.000|TR0|
20110127232143.000|20110127232145.000|TR0|Florida has been trying to overhaul its 
20110127232145.000|20110127232147.000|TR0|public school system for years to make 
20110127232147.000|20110127232150.000|TR0|teachers and schools more accountable.  
20110127232150.000|20110127232152.000|TR0|But a lot of parents, teachers and 
20110127232152.000|20110127232154.000|TR0|lawmakers are opposed.  Last year, 
20110127232154.000|20110127232157.000|TR0|Governor Crist vetoed a bill in Florida

20110127232159.000|20110127232202.000|TR0|students' achievement.

20110127233259.000|20110127233302.000|TR0|
20110127233302.000|20110127233304.000|TR0|CANDACE WILL, ASSISTANT FBI DIRECTOR,

20110127233314.000|20110127233316.000|TR0|Will oversees the Office of Professional 
20110127233316.000|20110127233318.000|TR0|Responsibility, which handles disciplinary 
20110127233318.000|20110127233321.000|TR0|proceedings.
20110127233321.000|20110127233323.000|TR0|
20110127233323.000|20110127233326.000|TR0|(voice-over) When you hear those type of 
20110127233326.000|20110127233328.000|TR0|allegations, suspension seem right to you 
20110127233328.000|20110127233330.000|TR0|versus being fired?
20110127233330.000|20110127233333.000|TR0|
20110127233333.000|20110127233335.000|TR0|WILL:  When I hear those types of 
20110127233335.000|20110127233337.000|TR0|allegations, I'm deeply aggrieved.  I 
20110127233337.000|20110127233340.000|TR0|don't -- I don't want to hear about any of 
20110127233340.000|20110127233342.000|TR0|our employees doing anything like that.
20110127233342.000|20110127233345.000|TR0|
20110127233345.000|20110127233347.000|TR0|But again, I -- my job is to look at the

20110127233349.000|20110127233352.000|TR0|
20110127233352.000|20110127233354.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  To some you could hear 
20110127233354.000|20110127233357.000|TR0|allegations like this and think, "Wow, it 
20110127233357.000|20110127233359.000|TR0|takes a lot of bad behavior to get fired

20110127233401.000|20110127233404.000|TR0|

20110127233805.000|20110127233808.000|TR0|

20110127234416.000|20110127234418.000|TR0|BLITZER:  They're digging out in the 
20110127234418.000|20110127234421.000|TR0|northeast once again from under as much as 
20110127234421.000|20110127234423.000|TR0|20 inches of snow.  And with almost two 
20110127234423.000|20110127234426.000|TR0|months of winter still left, many local 
20110127234426.000|20110127234428.000|TR0|governments are watching their snow 
20110127234428.000|20110127234430.000|TR0|removal budgets simply melt away.  CNN's 
20110127234430.000|20110127234433.000|TR0|Mary Snow is joining us from New York City.
20110127234433.000|20110127234435.000|TR0|
20110127234435.000|20110127234437.000|TR0|Mary, New York and the entire area has 
20110127234437.000|20110127234440.000|TR0|been very hard hit.
20110127234440.000|20110127234442.000|TR0|
20110127234442.000|20110127234445.000|TR0|MARY SNOW, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Yes.  So 
20110127234445.000|20110127234447.000|TR0|many storms in the span of a month, and 
20110127234447.000|20110127234449.000|TR0|you know, Wolf, New York has gotten 36 
20110127234449.000|20110127234452.000|TR0|inches of snow since the start of January. 
20110127234452.000|20110127234454.000|TR0| That's something the city has never seen 
20110127234454.000|20110127234457.000|TR0|before.  The story is similar across the 
20110127234457.000|20110127234459.000|TR0|northeast.  It's putting cities and towns 
20110127234459.000|20110127234501.000|TR0|in the red.  And in some cases, smaller

20110127234620.000|20110127234623.000|TR0|and water.  Kathleen Donovan is the county 
20110127234623.000|20110127234625.000|TR0|executive.
20110127234625.000|20110127234627.000|TR0|
20110127234627.000|20110127234630.000|TR0|KATHLEEN DONOVAN, BERGEN COUNTY EXECUTIVE: 
20110127234630.000|20110127234632.000|TR0| What that does is prevent the snow from 
20110127234632.000|20110127234635.000|TR0|sticking for up to two inches so it buys 
20110127234635.000|20110127234637.000|TR0|us time in terms of having to have our 
20110127234637.000|20110127234639.000|TR0|crews go out and plow, but it also saves 
20110127234639.000|20110127234642.000|TR0|money.       SNOW:  It's used on sidewalks 
20110127234642.000|20110127234644.000|TR0|and parking lots, and in some cases

20110127235511.000|20110127235514.000|TR0|gone.  CNN's Jeanne Moos takes a "Most 
20110127235514.000|20110127235516.000|TR0|Unusual" look.

20110127235525.000|20110127235528.000|TR0|(voice-over):  Is this any way to treat a 
20110127235528.000|20110127235530.000|TR0|world-famous piano that struck a chord 
20110127235530.000|20110127235533.000|TR0|with millions?  Dragged away by Biscayne 
20110127235533.000|20110127235535.000|TR0|Towing with photographers capturing every 
20110127235535.000|20110127235537.000|TR0|moment.
20110127235537.000|20110127235540.000|TR0|

20110127235542.000|20110127235545.000|TR0|sand bar never took piano lessons, but he 
20110127235545.000|20110127235547.000|TR0|has learned a lesson.

20110127235552.000|20110127235554.000|TR0|not to dump pianos in the bay for it is 
20110127235554.000|20110127235557.000|TR0|against the law.
20110127235557.000|20110127235559.000|TR0|
